Weekly State of the Market - Sovereign Bonds & Rates (2025-09-16)

Sovereign Bonds & Rates

Executive Summary

The latest Commitments of Traders (COT) data for Sovereign Bonds and Rates reveals a highly divergent sentiment among speculators. A massive unwinding of bearish positions in Fed Funds futures signals a significant shift in interest rate expectations. Conversely, Ultra US T-Bonds are experiencing intensifying bearish pressure, while standard US T-Bonds show signs of reduced bearish conviction.

Key Opportunities

  • Fed Funds Reversal: A dramatic reduction in speculative net-short positioning suggests a potential capitulation among rate bears, indicating an imminent floor or rebound in Fed Funds futures prices.
  • UST Bond Stabilization: Speculators are reducing net-short exposure in UST Bonds, signaling potential for price stabilization or a short-term bullish bounce.

Key Risks

  • Ultra US T-Bond Downside: Intensifying speculative net-short positioning signals persistent and potentially severe downside risk for the long end of the US Treasury curve.
  • Rates Market Divergence: The starkly contrasting speculative flows across different rate and bond instruments highlight underlying market uncertainty and risks of increased volatility.

Asset Class Summaries

UST Bond

  • Speculators:Dominantly bearish with a net-short position of -94,138 contracts, but significantly reduced net-shorts by 4,470 contracts WoW. Current COT Index: 53.47.
  • Commercials:Net-long, taking the opposing side to speculators, consistent with their hedging mandate.
  • Implication:Bearish conviction is waning; this suggests potential for price stabilization or a short-covering bounce in the near term.

Ultra US T Bond

  • Speculators:Strongly bearish, increasing their net-short position by 12,686 contracts to -278,167 contracts WoW. Current COT Index: 46.50.
  • Commercials:Heavily net-long, reflecting a robust hedging stance against declining bond prices.
  • Implication:Speculators are intensifying bearish bets, indicating sustained downward pressure and further downside potential for long-duration Treasuries.

Fed Funds

  • Speculators:Bearish, but dramatically reduced net-short positions by 87,943 contracts to -119,513 contracts WoW. This is a major unwind of bearish bets. Current COT Index: 39.50.
  • Commercials:Net-long, adjusting positions to accommodate the significant speculative shift.
  • Implication:A substantial capitulation by rate bears implies a potential shift in monetary policy expectations, signaling a possible floor for Fed Funds futures prices or a reversal in trend.
